intro: Cladoblasia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and inconspicuous flowers that are typically grouped in clusters. The plant produces achenes, which are small, dry fruits that disperse seeds via the wind. Cladoblasia species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic contexts.
